description: Returns the description of a specific Amazon EFS file system if either the file system CreationToken or the FileSystemId is provided. Otherwise, it returns descriptions of all file systems owned by the caller's Amazon Web Services account in the Amazon Web Services Region of the endpoint that you're calling. When retrieving all file system descriptions, you can optionally specify the MaxItems parameter to limit the number of descriptions in a response. This number is automatically set to 100. If more file system descriptions remain, Amazon EFS returns a NextMarker, an opaque token, in the response. In this case, you should send a subsequent request with the Marker request parameter set to the value of NextMarker. To retrieve a list of your file system descriptions, this operation is used in an iterative process, where DescribeFileSystems is called first without the Marker and then the operation continues to call it with the Marker parameter set to the value of the NextMarker from the previous response until the response has no NextMarker. The order of file systems returned in the response of one DescribeFileSystems call and the order of file systems returned across the responses of a multi-call iteration is unspecified. This operation requires permissions for the elasticfilesystem:DescribeFileSystems action.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: Present if provided by caller in the request (String).

nested_items.name: FileSystems
nested_items.description: An array of file system descriptions.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account that created the file system.

nested_items.name: CreationToken
nested_items.description: The opaque string specified in the request.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The ID of the file system, assigned by Amazon EFS.

nested_items.name: FileSystemArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the EFS file system, in the format arn:aws:elasticfilesystem:region:account-id:file-system/file-system-id ``. Example with sample data: ``arn:aws:elasticfilesystem:us-west-2:1111333322228888:file-system/fs-01234567

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time that the file system was created, in seconds (since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z).

nested_items.name: LifeCycleState
nested_items.description: The lifecycle phase of the file system.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: You can add tags to a file system, including a Name tag. For more information, see  CreateFileSystem. If the file system has a Name tag, Amazon EFS returns the value in this field.

nested_items.name: NumberOfMountTargets
nested_items.description: The current number of mount targets that the file system has. For more information, see  CreateMountTarget.

nested_items.name: SizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The latest known metered size (in bytes) of data stored in the file system, in its Value field, and the time at which that size was determined in its Timestamp field. The Timestamp value is the integer number of seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z. The SizeInBytes value doesn't represent the size of a consistent snapshot of the file system, but it is eventually consistent when there are no writes to the file system. That is, SizeInBytes represents actual size only if the file system is not modified for a period longer than a couple of hours. Otherwise, the value is not the exact size that the file system was at any point in time.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The latest known metered size (in bytes) of data stored in the file system.

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: The time at which the size of data, returned in the Value field, was determined. The value is the integer number of seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.

nested_items.name: ValueInIA
nested_items.description: The latest known metered size (in bytes) of data stored in the Infrequent Access storage class.

nested_items.name: ValueInStandard
nested_items.description: The latest known metered size (in bytes) of data stored in the Standard storage class.

nested_items.name: ValueInArchive
nested_items.description: The latest known metered size (in bytes) of data stored in the Archive storage class.

nested_items.name: PerformanceMode
nested_items.description: The performance mode of the file system.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that, if true, indicates that the file system is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The ID of an KMS key used to protect the encrypted file system.

nested_items.name: ThroughputMode
nested_items.description: Displays the file system's throughput mode. For more information, see Throughput modes in the Amazon EFS User Guide.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedThroughputInMibps
nested_items.description: The amount of provisioned throughput, measured in MiBps, for the file system. Valid for file systems using ThroughputMode set to provisioned.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneName
nested_items.description: Describes the Amazon Web Services Availability Zone in which the file system is located, and is valid only for One Zone file systems. For more information, see Using EFS storage classes in the Amazon EFS User Guide.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneId
nested_items.description: The unique and consistent identifier of the Availability Zone in which the file system is located, and is valid only for One Zone file systems. For example, use1-az1 is an Availability Zone ID for the us-east-1 Amazon Web Services Region, and it has the same location in every Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags associated with the file system, presented as an array of Tag objects.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The tag key (String). The key can't start with aws:.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag key.

nested_items.name: FileSystemProtection
nested_items.description: Describes the protection on the file system.

nested_items.name: ReplicationOverwriteProtection
nested_items.description: The status of the file system's replication overwrite protection.
ENABLED --- The file system cannot be used as the destination file system in a replication configuration. The file system is writeable. Replication overwrite protection is ENABLED by default.
DISABLED --- The file system can be used as the destination file system in a replication configuration. The file system is read-only and can only be modified by EFS replication.
REPLICATING --- The file system is being used as the destination file system in a replication configuration. The file system is read-only and is only modified only by EFS replication.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: Present if there are more file systems than returned in the response (String). You can use the NextMarker in the subsequent request to fetch the descriptions.
